section.title: Installation
section.para:
Do the installation of the TextMarker workbench as follows:
Download, install and start an Eclipse instance in version 3.7. Eclipse can be obtained from the eclipse.org download site.
Add the Apache UIMA update site ( http://www.apache.org/dist/uima/eclipse-update-site/
) to the available software sites in your Eclipse installation. To do so, click Help → Install New Software
and add each site. This opens the install wizard which can be seen in
Enter the TextMarker update site in field Work with: and press Enter .
The Apache UIMA TextMarker Eclipse tooling and runtime support
feature will be displayed. Select it by clicking into the related checkbox.
Also select Contact all update sites during install to find required software
and click on
Next
.
On the next page click Next again. Now, the license agreement site is diplayed. To install TextMarker read the license and choose I accept the ... if you agree to it. If you agreed, click on Finish

Now, TextMarker is going to be installed. After the successful installation, switch to the TextMarker perspective. To get an overview see
.

Several times within this chapter we use a TextMarker example project to illustrate the use of the TextMarker workbench. The example project can be downloaded per svn from https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/uima/sandbox/trunk/TextMarker/example-projects/
.

To import this project into the workbench do File → Import...
. Select Existing Projects into Workspace under General . Select the ExampleProject directory in your file system as root directory and click on Finish . The example project is now available in your workspace.
